data.title: Best Bands ever of any genre
data.meta_description: Id like to see what can show up in here.  I'm very interested in becoming a knowledgeable music man.   Help me out if you can!!!! :)
data.text:
Heavy Metal - Tool

Death metal - Nile

Synth-Pop - Depeche Mode

Country - Junior Brown

Hard Rock - Led Zeppelin (is that a fair genre for them?)

Rock and Roll - Beatles

Joy Division is the best of their genre. Whatever you want to call it. I believe some newage douchebags call it Post-Punk. So that.

I'd say that Led Zeppelin is more Blues-Rock than hard rock, although they are known for being able to work in many genres. But no matter what genre anyone wants to place them in, they are one of the greatest bands to ever play.

But as for Hard Rock, I'd say Van Halen is the best at that genre, although you're bound to get many different opinions for each genre.

Arent genres in general pointless and redundant? My mp3 collection is broken into 4 categories and that's only because I've got like 500+ albums in there and it's hard to find specific stuff without decently sorting it out.

Hip-hop/R&B/Hip-hop related stuff, Rock/Rock related music, Trance/trance-like music, and Jazz/Chillout/Classical/Slow Stuff

Event Horizon

Pop- None. Pop sucks.

From this thread:

https://www.gtplanet.net/forum/showthread.php?t=44944

Event Horizon

Is Good Charolette considered Pop? I heard some consider them pop, but I don't. How does one classify "pop." What makes a band a "Pop" band?

Event Horizon

Am I the only one who likes a few Good Charolette songs?

Everyone likes a little pop, it's everywhere.

Metal - Black Sabbath

Pyschedelic Rock - Pink Floyd

Progressive Metal - Tool

Industrial - Nine Inch Nails

Nu-Metal - Deftones

Death Metal - In Flames

Hard Rock - Soil

I'm sure Led Zeppelin fits in here somewhere, but I don't know what to categorize them under...

emad

Metal - Symphony X

Symphony X are Power Metal. All those symphonic metal like Symphony X, Stratovarius, etc are power metal.

I was really hooked on rage against the machine for a while a long time after they broke up so I really dont know anything bout them. I heard somewhere that they might have been fake and that they didnt really support wat they wrote. Is this true? Id like to know

thanx

Industrial - Ministry

Heavy Metal - Pantera

Death Metal - In Flames

Progressive Metal - Rammstein

Rock - Smashing Pumpkins

Hard Rock - Too many to mention

Blues Rock - Led Zeppelin

Trance - Chicane

Techno - Aphex Twin Other notables include: Crystal method, and Orbital

House - Fatboy Slim Other notables include: Bassment Jaxx, Daft Punk, and Fluke

Trip Hop - Dj Shadow Other notables include: Junkie XL, Massive Attack, and Theivery Corp.

Drum N' Bass - Photek Other notables include: Amon Tobin

Hardcore Techno - Prodigy Notables such as: Squarepusher, Curve, Humble Brothers.

Old School Rap - Naughty by Nature

Rap - uhm.... don't really like rap. Beastie Boys are ok I guess *shrugs* Oh wait I like Mos Def but he's kinda Hip Hop.

Video Game music - Daiki Kasho, Hitoshi Sakimoto or Nobuo Uematsu

Classical - Mike Oldfield is cool..... oh wait! Sergei Rachmaninoff

Country - Country sucks ass.... Kenny Rogers is ok for Xmas music though.. meh.

New Age - uhm..... no one Vangelis is pretty cool though.

Pop - ermhh... can't think of any right now

Soft Rock - Coldplay

Jimmy Enslashay

Theres too many genres, I propose sorting them into this:

Pop:

Love Music:

Rap:

R'n'B:

Country:

Classical:

Punk:

Metal:

Rock:

Rock'n'Roll:

Blues:

Jazz:

Ethnic:

Techno/Trance/etc:

Pop Rock:

Copy that and put some bands/singers into those categories.

Of course there are heaps of genres. Most of them are derived from people who don't know what to classify a band as, so they make up some crazy genre...

Jimmy Enslashay

Heavy Metal - Slayer

Death Metal - Deicide currently for me, but best ever maybe Morbid Angel or Cannibal Corpse.

I agree with Jimmy Enslashay with Slayer as the best in Heavy Metal, the others would be (Butthead: He said wood)

Pop: Michael Jackson

Love Music: Cutting Crew

Rap: Tupac (Not my favorite, is the only rap band I know of, since my brother listens to him)

R'n'B: ?

Country: ?

Classical: ?

Punk: Rancid

Metal: Slayer

Rock: Motley Crue

Rock'n'Roll: Elvis Presley

Blues: ?

Jazz: Xavier Cugat

Ethnic: ?

Techno/Trance/etc: ?

Pop Rock: Gary Numan(?) (NOt sure what Pop Rock is)

The ones with: ? means I don't know what the genre is.

Funk Rock - Red Hot Chili Peppers [my fav band]

Alternative Pop Rock - Ben Folds (Five)

Acid Jazz Funk Pop Dance - Jamiroquai

Celtic Alternative Rock - Cranberries

Jazz Funk - Tower Of Power

Comedy Alternative Rock - Tenacious D, Shirehorses [too close]

Rap Metal - Linkin Park

Break Beat - 4 Hero [top group, check it out]

Urban Crossover - Beverley Knight

Pop Punk - Green Day

But you can go on all day, because at the end of the day each band has it's own genre. The only genre that you really can pigeon hole is pop, because so much of it gets churned out.

Led zep ..put them in whatever catagory you please. mettalica ..metal.. guns 'n roses in the sex drugs and rock till you drop then disapear catagory. alice in chains for the "why did we name us that" ? catagory ..honorable mention tool and Anthrax.

The doors in wtf is he saying ? wtf does it mean ? catagory.Red hot Chilli peppers in the dance naked with socks on the pepper catagory. Pink floyd in the " wow look at the pretty colors" catagory and the GRATEFULL DEAD for the " how the hell did they ever make so much cash" ? catagory along with honorable mention for the best performance while stoned and the wtf is he saying ? and the most drugs swallowed at a sitting without death or live embalment catagorys.

I just realised I posted a list to go by, and I didn't use it myself. Here goes:

Pop: God no....

Love Music: Even worse....

Rap: Bone Thugs 'n' Harmony (I hate rap with a passion, but these guys are fast and alot of my friends like 'em so it's a mention for my friends I spose)

R'n'B: Ugh...

Country: Country music ruins Australia's image, so I'm not gonna post that....

Classical: Mozart? Beethoven?? meh...

Punk: My enemy, least favourite genre.....I'll kill it off one day...Lol.

Metal: Slayer; Deicide.

Rock: AC/DC

Rock'n'Roll: Santana

Blues: Blues Brothers...it's all I really know...

Jazz: Bernard Hemmerman (Created the "Taxi Driver Theme", and I love that movie)

Ethnic: Deodato (Hispanic Jazz, listen to Espantoso in Vice City)

Techno/Trance/etc: Oh hell no....

Pop Rock: Van Halen (Yes, Pop Rock, it's my opinion and I'm sticking by it)
